data.question: Have a wonderful day
data.answer:
The translation of "Have a wonderful day" into Spanish is:

"Tenga un día maravilloso"

(Note: You can also use "Disfrute de un excelente día" or "Que tenga un buen día" as alternative translations, depending on the context and tone you want to convey.)

data.question: nice to meet you
data.answer:
Translation:

"nice to meet you"

Spanish:

"encantado de conocerte" (formal)
"encantada de conocerte" (informal)

data.question: Welcome to my home
data.answer:
मेरे घर में आपका स्वागत है (Mere ghar mein aapka swagat hai)

Note: "आपका स्वागत है" is a common phrase used in Indian culture, which literally means "your welcome" or "you are welcome".

data.question: surprisingly it works fantastic
data.answer:
Überaus funktioniert es fantastisch.

Breakdown:

* "surprisingly" translates to "überaus", which is an adverb meaning "remarkably" or "to a great extent".
* "it" is neutral, so the pronoun remains the same ("es").
* "works" becomes "funktioniert", which is the third person singular of the verb "funktionieren", meaning "to function" or "to work".
* "fantastic" translates to "fantastisch", which means "exceptionally good" or "excellent".

data.question: Welcome to thailand
data.answer:
Here's the translation:

สวัสดีต้อนรับไทย (Sawatdee tuaanrap thai)

Here's a breakdown of the translation:

* สวัสดี (Sawatdee) means "Welcome"
* ต้อนรับ (Tuaanrap) is an expression that means "to welcome" or "to greet"
* ไทย (Thai) simply means "Thailand"
